intro: Eriospermum exile, commonly known as the slender eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
